newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS -- Issues to watch - March 12.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS -- Issues to watch - March 12.

text.p: * Nike Inc, buffeted during regular trading hours Tuesday by a published report of lost orders, held steady after the bell at its closing price, traders said.
The stock fell as low as 63 at one point Tuesday but recovered to close at 66-3/8, down 1/2 on the day.
* Macromedia Inc said late Tuesday it expects "a substantial loss" in the fourth quarter because it is delaying the release of its Director 6 Multimedia Studio. Macromedia closed at 9-3/16.
* Chrysler Corp on Tuesday forecast second quarter worldwide production of 809,000 vehicles, up 4.3 percent from the 775,800 vehicles produced in the 1996 second quarter.
The company lowered by 6,900 vehicles its projected output for the first quarter, to 765,700.
* Cisco Systems Inc, which dropped 5/8 to 52-3/4 Tuesday, was up 1/8 to 52-7/8 in London but trading volume was thin.
* Marsh & McLennan Cos Inc and Johnson & Higgins said Wednesday they had agreed to merge.

Under terms of a definitive agreement, Marsh & McLennan will acquire Johnson & Higgins for $1.8 billion -- one-third payable in cash and two-thirds in Marsh & McLennan common stock, a statement issued by Marsh & McLennan said.
